snippet: Tau Epsilon Phi pledges were served alcohol, told to take off their clothes down to their underwear, then stripped of their underwear by other students, officials said.
abstract: Cornell University withdraws its recognition of Tau Epsilon Phi fraternity after an October 2012 hazing incident; episode comes two years after a Cornell student died following a fraternity drinking ritual.
lead_paragraph: Tau Epsilon Phi pledges were served alcohol, told to take off their clothes down to their underwear, then stripped of their underwear by other students, officials said.

headline.seo: Report of Hazing Leads Cornell to Withdraw Recognition of Fraternity
headline.main: Cornell Withdraws Recognition of a Fraternity After a Report of Hazing
headline.print_headline: Cornell Withdraws Recognition of a Fraternity After a Report of Hazing
